faqs.question: What is the typical rental yield expected from a commercial shop in Sector 82

faqs.question: Are commercial shops in Sector 82 generally freehold or leasehold properties
faqs.answer: Most commercial shops in Sector 82 are offered on a long-term leasehold basis, typically 99 years, adhering to the land allotment norms set by the development authority. While not freehold, this long tenure provides virtually the same rights and security as ownership, allowing for selling, leasing, or transferring the property. We ensure all legal documentation clearly outlines the lease conditions and transferability clauses before you commit to purchasing a Shop For Sale in Sector 82.

faqs.question: What documentation is required to purchase a commercial shop in this area
faqs.answer: Key documentation includes the Allotment Letter or Sub-Lease Deed, the Occupancy Certificate (OC) or Completion Certificate (CC) if the property is ready, the Builder Buyer Agreement, and all relevant mutation records. For resale units, the previous sale deed and necessary no-objection certificates from the society or RWA are also required. Our legal team assists in verifying the authenticity and completeness of all documents throughout the transaction process.

faqs.question: What is the difference between an assured return project and a standard sale shop
faqs.answer: An assured return project guarantees the investor a fixed monthly or quarterly return (e.g., 10-12 percent) during the construction phase until possession, often functioning as a high-risk high-reward scheme. A standard sale shop involves purchasing the unit outright, with returns generated only upon completion and successful leasing. Standard sales are generally considered less risky once possession is secured, focusing on long-term rental income and capital gains.

Simply search using the project name, developer name, or the RERA registration number provided by the seller or developer.
